TopicTitle: The Hellion, a very fast, very stable air-racer that laughs in the face of SAS

Articles.Content:
TheHellion:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Designed to remain stable at high-speed, low-altitude flights without the need for SAS to guide you. The low-profile makes landing and taking off a bit tricky, I'd recommend ~33% throttle for take-off, and cut the engines all together for landing and just glide it in. This craft abuses part-clipping.

(Download the .craft file here (MediaFire))

Let me know what you think!

Edited July 28, 2013 by zombiphylax
Right off the bat it should hit around 270m/s at around 1km. It will exceed 300m/s through the KerBull air-race mountain courses while remaining stable.
